body.directions: Please read the phrases in Chinese, and then answer the question that follows.

body.quiz: Which of the following words have the same pinyin final as the word?
body.answer: Audio for 高 gāo
options: Audio for 最 zuì
Audio for 汤 tāng
Audio for 茶 chá
body.correct: Job wonderfully done! Both 要 yào (to want) and 高 gāo (tall) have the same final “ao.” Nice catch!
body.incorrect: Not quite… try to sound out the word; then compare it with the audios in the options.

body.quiz: Which of the following can the action indicated by this word not be reasonably applied?
body.correct: Outstanding job! The action 炒 chǎo (to stir-fry) can be applied to meat or vegetables. It would not be reasonable to “stir-fry milk.”
body.incorrect: Oops... think about the meaning of the word; then consider the action it indicates related to cooking food.

body.quiz: Which of the following does not belong in the same category as this word?
body.answer: Audio for 曲奇 qǔqí
options: Audio for 杯 bēi
Audio for 叉子 chāzi
Audio for 盘 pán
body.correct: You got it! 碗 wǎn (bowl) is a type of utensil, and so are the options except 曲奇 qǔqí (cookie).
body.incorrect: So close! Think about the meaning of the word, and then listen to the options carefully to understand the items they represent.

body.quiz: Which of the following phrases correctly uses this word as a measure word?
body.answer: 三个橙子 sān gè chéngzi
options: 个三橙子 gè sān chéngzi
面包个四 miànbāo gè sì
四面包个 sì miànbāo gè
body.correct: You got it! 个 gè means “count of.” It is placed after a number and before the object as a measure word.
body.incorrect: So close! Think about the meaning of the word, then think about how it’s used in a phrase or sentence.
